ContentClassification.TableReference: Walter J. McLaughlin, “A Corporate Pension Plan Mortality Table Based on Recent Experience”, Proceedings of the Conference of Consulting Actuaries Vol. 39 (1989) Table 12, p. 267-268.
ContentClassification.TableDescription: 1989 George B. Buck Mortality Table – Male. Minimum Age: 10 Maximum Age: 115
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: Data from 21 largest retirement plans for which George B. Buck Consulting Actuaries, Inc. serves as actuary. Plans considered for the study were those with at least 1,000 pensioners, and had a formal disability plan. Data from banks and governmental plans was excluded as the study was intended to reflect mortality experience of industrial clients. Experience covered calendar years 1983-87. The study of active members constituted 2,016,390 life-years while the pensioners’ study was based on exposure of 1,083,303 life years. Methodology: Crude rates at fifth ages were plotted and then intermediate values obtained from interpolation. Active service rates were adjusted by 6% to allow for the fact that exposures at the beginning of the years included those who withdrew or retired during the year. Note that previous studies used 10%. The gap between active members and pensioners was bridged by linear interpolation from age 55 to 70 for men and women. Since there was little data above 100, rates for men and women were set equal to rates from the 1984 Buck Mortality Table (See SOA Table Identities 871 and 872) and arbitrarily improved for the five year period since that study. Rates between ages 90 and 100 were derived y geometric interpolation. At low ages (10-20) there was virtually no experience therefore the 1984 Buck Mortality Table study data was improved for 5 years by the use of Projection Scale H (See SOA Table Identities 910 and 911). So as to be appropriate for valuation purposes, a margin of conservatism was added. Rates, with the margins, were then graduated with a Whittaker-Henderson Type A method. Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 04/2013.

MetaData.TableDescription: 1989 George B. Buck Mortality Table – Male. Minimum Age: 10 Maximum Age: 115
